Question 90) According to the report “The Great Shadow of Livestock” (Livestock's Long Shadow), made by the United Nations Agriculture and Food Organization, cattle is responsible for about 18% of global warming, a higher contribution than the transportation sector.
The breeding of large -scale cattle contributes to global warming through the emission of
A) Methane during the digestion process.
B) Nitrous oxide during the rumination process.
C) chlorofluorcarbon while transporting meat.
D) Nitrous oxide during the respiratory process.
E) sulfur dioxide during pasture consumption.
